I think this song works on two different levels and perspectives.

One one hand, the song reads like a realtime story. It is unfolding with every verse Eminem sings. His lines are describing what's happening right now, and Rihanna recaps the theme of the song with her chorus. It's an abusive relationship that she is unable/unwilling to get out of. Their relationship is spiralling downwards, and at the end he makes a threat of what will happen if she leaves again.
And we're left to wonder what DOES happen.

But if you look at it another way, we find out what happens. All of Eminem's verses are a flashback of the events leading up to that threat, which is the last thing that happens before the song starts. This is what's happening right now:

"Just gonna stand there and watch me burn
But that's alright because I like the way it hurts
Just gonna stand there and hear me cry
But that's alright because I love the way you lie"

He is literally standing there, watching her burn and hearing her cry, and thinking about everything that happened leading up to this. Rihanna's lines become the present. 

Listen to the song back to back. The first time picture Eminem's verses as the present. The second time, picture his verses as the past. And in between imagine that she tried to leave again and he acted out his threat. This perspective certainly makes the song a lot darker.

Not sure if that makes sense to anyone, it looks a little confusing when I put it in writing...

I believe when the lyrics say "I like" and "I love" the way you lie...it is a mocking comment.  No woman, man or child likes or loves to be abused.  But most of the time the abuser is trapped into thinking or believing that she/he desires it.  We believe that it is our fault, that we are not able to stand without a partner, that nobody will love us again if we leave. Maybe we don't have a place to go so we stay with the abuser.  There are so many lies that I told myself when I was on the abusive cycle.  It is very hard to get off and I truly have a heart and much compassion for those who fall victim to this tragedy.  I also believe the victim has issues from the past.  Maybe there was abuse in the home and the victim has learned this behavior from childhood.

What ever the reasons, what ever the case... there is NO excuse for abuse.  We can and we must have healthy boundaries and say NO to violence of any kind. IT is simply NOT ACCEPTABLE. It causes so much pain, trauma and sometimes even death to the victim.  It is a sometimes silent killer especially if the abuse is mental, emotional or spiritual.  It is silent because there are oftentimes no bruises and the victim appears to be alright...But he/she suffers silently.  

PLEASE if you know or suspect a loved one or a friend that is going through this....HELP THEM!! Offer a place for them to stay and get involved.  Do not let someone you know or love suffer needlessly and helplessly.

God Bless and peace to all of you...love yourselves, you are worth it

Neither person in this situation can call themselves the victim, because they've both played a hand in what has happened between them. This song is a story about two people who are deeply in love.  Both of them seem to thrive off the adrenaline of the fight and the addictive calm that follows it.  He becomes addicted to the power, to that desire to hurt her, make her want to kill him.  This is proof, in a way, that he is important to her, important enough to make her break down.  Eventually, it goes too far and he does what he never thought he would:  begins to throw her around and hit her.

He tells her that he loves her, swears he will never do it again.  The tragic part of it is that he really DOES love her and he really DOESN'T want to do it again.  He treats her like a queen and for awhile life is blissful for the two of them.  There is this beautiful delusion that everything has changed, that such deeply ingrained behavior patterns will just disappear if both parties try hard enough.  Unfortunately, trying so hard becomes a strain on the relationship, partly because his need for power has been gnawing at him this whole time, partners fall short of expectations, and the abusive relationship starts all over again. 

They both love each other, need each other, can't imagine living without each other.
